name: Natalie Portman
religion: Portman is a Jew. She speaks Hebrew, was born in Jerusalem, and considers Israel her real home. But she said that she doesn't believe in an afterlife.
politicalViews: Portman is a liberal Democrat--like most of Hollywood--but has a Harvard degree, is well-spoken, and tends to pick reputable causes.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.text: Natalie Portman was born in Jerusalem, Israel.
Portman is Jewish, from both sides of her family. Some of her ancestors were holocaust victims. Even with this kind of connection, Portman refuses to do Jewish films. She once said:

content.sourceTitle: Natalie Portman's Rules: No 'Boobs' or Jewish Roles
content.text: I've always tried to stay away from playing Jews. I get like 20 Holocaust scripts a month, but I hate the genre.

content.sourceTitle: Natalie on The Late Show with David Letterman "Closer."
content.text: Even so, Judaism is very important to Portman. She speaks Hebrew
and she once expressed her desire to pass along her Jewish heritage, saying:

content.sourceTitle: Help find Natalie a nice Jewish man
content.text: A priority for me is definitely that I'd like to raise my kids Jewish.
And though she holds dual citizenship in both the United States and Israel, she has said that she feels more at home in Israel.

One wonders if Judaism is really more of a cultural feature of Portman and less of an issue of faith. Her own theology seems to border on atheism. When asked if she believes in an afterlife, she said:
I don't believe in that. I believe this is it.

Portman is a Harvard-educated Hollywood liberal. She was an outspoken critic of George W. Bush and, in 2004, a supporter of Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry. She said of Bush during that election cycle:

content.sourceTitle: Portman Wants Bush To Have An Extended Vacation
content.text: If people are for Bush – the president with the most days of vacation that any president–I think if you really love him, give him a long vacation.
In 2008, Portman initially supported Hillary Clinton,
but when Barack Obama won the Democratic nomination, Portman stood behind him.

content.sourceTitle: Why Lea Michele and Natalie Portman Went Vegan
content.text: Portman is a vegan and an animal rights activist.

She has been involved with movements to reduce poverty and particularly active in an organization called the Foundation for International Community Assistance, which encourages and provides micro-loans to third-world entrepreneurs.

content.sourceTitle: Natalie Portman and fiance join campaign urging President Obama's support for gay marriage
content.text: Portman has also been a champion of gay rights and the rights for gays to marry. She signed an open letter to President Obama, asking him to support gay marriage.

Portman is often spoken highly of, even by politicians and the intellectual elite. She seems to care about society and politics and manages to raise awareness in her incredibly adorable way without regularly annoying the public as just another celebrity activist.
